text.18_Shabbat Morning Services, 1_Shema & B: There is no measure to you, there is no one else but you, it's impossibl​​e without you, and who can be compared to you? There is no measure to you, God our Lord, in this world, and none beside you, our King, for life in the world to come. It's impossibl​​e without you, our redeemer,​ for the days of the Mashiach,​ and none compare to you, our savior, at the resurrect​ion of the dead.
text.17_Shabbat Evening Meal, 2_Eishet Chayil: She looketh well to the ways of her household​​​​, and eateth not the bread of idleness.​
text.17_Shabbat Evening Meal, 1_Shalom Aleich: I give you thanks, God and God of my fathers. For all the kindness that You did with me and that You will do with me and with all the members of my household and with all your creations members of my covenant. And blessed are Your holy angles who perform your will. Master of peace, King to whom peace belongs, bless me with peace. And order for me and for all the members of my household and for all your nation the house of Israel to a life of good and peace: High King upon all the high hosts. Our creator the creator of the universe.
text.17_Shabbat Evening Meal, 2_Eishet Chayil: She seeketh wool and flax, and worketh willingly​ with her hands.
text.0_Upon Arising, 1_Tallit, 5_Paragraph: ... Blessed are You, LORD our God, King of the universe, You sanctified us with his commandments and commanded us to wrap ourselves in tzitzit.
text.0_Upon Arising, 0_Modeh Ani, 7_Paragraph: ... The Torah which Moses commanded us is the heritage of the congregation of Jacob.
text.17_Shabbat Evening Meal, 2_Eishet Chayil: She layeth her hands to the distaff, and her hands hold the spindle.
She considere​th a field, and buyeth it; with the fruit of her hands she planteth a vineyard.​
She maketh linen garments and selleth them; and deliveret​h girdles unto the merchant.​
She doeth him good and not evil all the days of her life.
text.0_Upon Arising, 0_Modeh Ani, 8_Paragraph: ... When donning the tzitzit he should say:
text.0_Upon Arising, 0_Modeh Ani, 0_Paragraph: ... The Order of Awaking in the Morning
text.17_Shabbat Evening Meal, 2_Eishet Chayil: Her husband is known in the gates, when he sitteth among the elders of the land.
She openeth her mouth with wisdom; and the law of kindness is on her tongue.
text.9_Mealtime Blessings, 0_Mealtime Blessin: ...Blessed are You, Lord our God, King of the universe, who has sanctified us with His commandments and Commanded us regarding the washing of hands.
text.17_Shabbat Evening Meal, 2_Eishet Chayil: She is like the merchant-​ships; she bringeth her food from afar.
She is not afraid of the snow for her household​​​​; for all her household​​​​ are clothed with scarlet.
Strength and dignity are her clothing;​ and she laugheth at the time to come.
text.20_Shabbat Day Meal, 2_Zemirot, 22_Parag: And they all came together in a covenant, ”We will do and we will listen,” they said as one. And they opened and answered, “God is one,” Blessed is the One who gives strength to the the tired. (translation by Abby Stein)
text.0_Upon Arising, 0_Modeh Ani, 9_Paragraph: ... Blessed are You, the LORD our God, King of the universe, Who has sanctified us with his commandments and has commanded us concerning the commandment of tzitzit.
text.17_Shabbat Evening Meal, 2_Eishet Chayil: Grace is deceitful​, and beauty is vain; but a woman that feareth the LORD, she shall be praised.
She riseth also while it is yet night, and giveth food to her household​​​​, and a portion to her maidens.
She girdeth her loins with strength,​ and maketh strong her arms.
She stretchet​h out her hand to the poor; yea, she reacheth forth her hands to the needy.
The heart of her husband doth safely trust in her, and he hath no lack of gain.
Her children rise up, and call her blessed; her husband also, and he praiseth her:
She maketh for herself coverlets​; her clothing is fine linen and purple.
Give her of the fruit of her hands; and let her works praise her in the gates.
'Many daughters​ have done valiantly​, but thou excellest​ them all.'
A woman of valour who can find? for her price is far above rubies.
text.0_Upon Arising, 0_Modeh Ani, 2_Paragraph: ... As soon as one awakes, he should rise like a lion to serve his Creator and say "I give thanks before you..." and so on until "Your faithfulness." [and since it does not contain the Divine Name,] it can be said without the washing of the hands.
text.0_Upon Arising, 0_Modeh Ani, 3_Paragraph: ... I give thanks before You, living and eternal King for You have returned my soul within me; great is Your faithfulness!
text.0_Upon Arising, 0_Modeh Ani, 6_Paragraph: ... Blessed is His Holy name and kingdom forever and ever.
text.17_Shabbat Evening Meal, 2_Eishet Chayil: She perceivet​h that her merchandi​se is good; her lamp goeth not out by night.
text.4_Weekday Maariv, 0_The Shema, 0_Paragra: Allow us, HaShem Elokeynu, to lie down in peace. Grant us, our King, to wake and rise to a life of goodness and peace. Spread over us the sukkah of your peace and guide us with your good counsel...
